column1: Teething is the growth of teeth through the gums in the mouth of infants and young children.

The signs of teething are: - Acting cranky or irritable - Biting or chewing on hard objects - Drooling, which may often begin before teething starts - Gum swelling and tenderness - Refusing food - Sleeping problems Teething does NOT cause fever or diarrhea.
If your child develops a fever or diarrhea and you are worried about it, talk to your health care provider.
You can buy the following medicines and remedies at the drug store: - Acetaminophen (Tylenol and others) or ibuprofen can help when your baby is very cranky or uncomfortable.
- DO NOT rub alcohol on your baby's gums.
